brief_summary.textblock:
Clinical research, like all science, is self-correcting, with errors detected by the
      scientific community and communicated to the publishing journals, which then relay the
      information (and its resolution) to its readers. If this relaying process fails, science
      grinds to a halt. In this study we are testing its integrity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Coordinated Assessment of Notifications of Trials Containing Overt Published Errors

detailed_description.textblock:
This prospective study documents the outcome of notification to journal editorial boards (or
      equivalent authorities) of factually incorrect or inconsistent claims, in reports they have
      published.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Report of a clinical trial in humans of treatment of heart disease with bone marrow
             derived stem cells

          -  Report containing discrepancy by reference to same report or another report

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Discrepancy has already been corrected by an erratum

clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Response of Medical Journal Editorial Boards to Notification of Serious Discrepancies in Published Clinical Trials in Human Patients.

overall_contact.last_name: Darrel P Francis, MA FRCP MD

overall_contact_backup.last_name: Graham D Cole, MA MB MRCP

overall_official.last_name: Darrel P Francis, MA MD FRCP

primary_outcome.measure: Time to correction, retraction, or other notification to the readership of  discrepancy

reference.citation: Nowbar AN, Mielewczik M, Karavassilis M, Dehbi HM, Shun-Shin MJ, Jones S, Howard JP, Cole GD, Francis DP; DAMASCENE writing group. Discrepancies in autologous bone marrow stem cell trials and enhancement of ejection fraction (DAMASCENE): weighted regression and meta-analysis. BMJ. 2014 Apr 28;348:g2688. doi: 10.1136/bmj.g2688.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to initial response from journal

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
